title: Interim Technology Manager
description:
Trip Builder was refactored to produce delivered trips as defined in the Project Deed for Sydney Light Rails Payment Mechanism (PayMech, v2 still under development) which determines the abatements owed by all the parties under the contract with Transport for New South Wales TfNSW.
Authored the ICT & Software Systems Management Plan Full Operations Phase for Sydney Light Rail.
Providing guidance on ICT works for CSELR and working with TfNSW to improve their reporting solution for Sydney Light Rail.

title: Systems Technician (IT Business Analyst)
description:
Leading investigations into poor performance, identifying key areas for improvement and improving business performance through the design and development of custom tools in Python, Angular 6, C++, Docker, and Golang.
Data produced by the Trip Builder project (Trippy) contributed to the following report:
https://www.scribd.com/document/386931640/Capacity-Constraint-Strategies
Referenced here:
https://www.google.com.au/amp/s/amp.smh.com.au/national/nsw/crush-capacity-the-worst-time-to-get-on-sydney-s-light-rail-20180823-p4zz8q.html

title: Systems Technician
description: Developed full-stack applications in Python, C++, Angular, Go, Bazel, Docker and Kubernetes making good use of Reactive Extensions and multistage Docker builds.

title: Raft Guide
description: My role at Rafting.ie was to ensure that the equipment and changing rooms were in working order before each trip. That the clients were equipped with the appropriate gear and that they had each signed an indemnity form before getting on the bus to the starting point. My primary role was to guide the clients safely down the river in one of Rafting.ie's six rafts.

title: Student Intern
description:
During my brief time with Bitesize Irish Gaelic I was asked to assist in restructuring the lessons the website provides along with some fellow students.
I was tasked with restructuring the lessons on the server-side into distinct categories and sub-categories using MySQL and PHP.
https://darraghdowney90.wordpress.com/2013/11/06/working-with-bitesize-irish-gaelic/

title: Job Practice Student - Junior Software Developer
description: As part of my work placement in FEXCO I acted as a system administrator for FEXCO Merchant Services knowledge base, which was hosted using Atlassian Confluence. I also wrote an application to convert pdfs to .png format using JMagick, a Java wrapper to ImageMagick's API, for desktop and almost completed the same application as a Confluence add-on.

title: Junior Materials Engineer
description: During my time with Rough Stuff Kayak Paddles I was charged with paddle assembly, assisting with kayak production and sales.
